p: R. carthamoides HR and SGR essential oils were able to protect astrocytes against oxidative stress by the reduction of intracellular ROS levels in LPS-stimulated cells. ROS production is activated by the NADPH oxidase (NOX) [ 38] and by cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) as a side-product in the synthesis of prostanoids [ 35]. It is known from literature that ROS can activate various signaling molecules such as protein kinase C, MAPK, and NF- κB which play an important role in regulating the gene expression of various proinflammatory factors [ 39]. The overproduction of ROS may lead to an increase of TNF- α level [ 33]. This highlights the relationship between inflammation and oxidative stress.
